intro: Eriogonum clavatum, commonly known as the clustered buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Eriogonum clavatum is often found in dry, open habitats such as hillsides and grasslands.
